intro: Dicerandra frutescens, commonly known as the Florida rainflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and parts of Georgia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Dicerandra frutescens is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
